description: Tata Consultancy Services is adapting to H-1B visa changes by significantly localizing its US workforce, now relying on just 500 visa holders. The IT giant also announced wage hikes for over 80% of its staff and is investing in AI-led talent development and acquiring industry experts. TCS is also providing enhanced severance packages for employees with skill mismatches.

title: Kuldeep Yadav’s artistry flattens West Indies, but John Campbell–Shai Hope rescue stand delays India’s charge
description: John Campbell's unbeaten 87 and Shai Hope's 66 led West Indies' strong resistance on day three, reaching 173 for two after being forced to follow on. Despite trailing by 97 runs, their unbroken 138-run partnership offered a glimmer of hope against India's bowlers, who were earlier stifled by Kuldeep Yadav's five-wicket haul.

description: A September Israeli bombing in Doha nearly derailed Gaza peace talks, prompting Qatar to threaten withdrawal. However, a direct intervention by Donald Trump, including a phone call between Netanyahu and Qatar's PM, salvaged the negotiations. This moment convinced Hamas of Trump's ability to influence Israel, paving the way for a significant ceasefire.

title: Bengal 'gang rape' horror: BJP leaders stopped from meeting victim; spar with cops
description: BJP leaders were prevented from meeting a med student allegedly gangraped in Durgapur, sparking accusations of a flawed probe. CM Mamata Banerjee's advice for girls to stay indoors at night drew sharp criticism, with one MLA comparing her administration to the Taliban. The accused have been remanded to police custody.

description: Smriti Mandhana has shattered records, becoming the youngest and fastest to 5000 ODI runs in women's cricket. Her brilliant 80 against Australia in Visakhapatnam showcased her exceptional talent and consistency. This remarkable feat underscores her status as a global cricketing icon and highlights the rising prominence of Indian women's cricket.

description: Indian STEM graduates are increasingly foregoing US careers after studies, with OPT participation dropping significantly. This shift stems from US immigration uncertainties and visa challenges, while countries like Canada and the UK offer clearer, faster work and residency pathways. The trend impacts US universities and employers, reflecting changing priorities for Indian talent seeking stable global careers.

title: Abhishek Bachchan dedicates Best Actor award to Aishwarya Rai and Aaradhya: ‘Their sacrifices have been one of the main reasons…’
Niti Aayog forecasts 4mn AI jobs by 2030: What roles will emerge; who benefits?
description: NITI Aayog’s Roadmap for Job Creation in the AI Economy outlines how Artificial Intelligence could create up to 4 million new jobs in India by 2030. While warning of displacement in routine tech roles, the report identifies emerging careers in AI engineering, ethics, training, and human-AI collaboration. It advocates for a National AI Talent Mission to drive education and reskilling. The roadmap positions India as a global hub for AI talent and innovation by 2035.

title: When Trump's tariff push met Beijing's counterpunch; US-China trade war explained
description: US-China trade tensions have reignited with Beijing imposing rare earth export curbs, sparking retaliation from Washington. China accuses the US of unfair practices, while the US criticizes China's actions as hostile. Both nations are now using export controls as leverage ahead of upcoming talks, potentially reshaping global supply chains and testing diplomatic limits.

Yadav also accused the BJP of using fake data.

Ayesha Curry’s marriage confession sparks backlash as NFL star Cam Newton steps in
description: NBA star Stephen Curry's wife, Ayesha, faced fan backlash for her candid remarks about not initially wanting marriage or children. Despite criticism, she received support from figures like Cam Newton, who praised her honesty.  Others, including Gilbert Arenas and Stephen himself, have rallied behind her, highlighting the misunderstanding of her sentiments.

title: No Nobel Prize in Mathematics: Why Alfred Nobel left the subject out of the honours
description: Alfred Nobel's will established prestigious awards for science, literature, and peace, but notably excluded mathematics. While popular myths abound, historical context suggests Nobel favored practical applications. Mathematicians are recognized through economics and specialized awards like the Fields Medal and Abel Prize, often dubbed the "Nobel of Mathematics."

title: Cam Newton’s kids: meet his 9 children and their three mothers
description: Former NFL quarterback Cam Newton has welcomed his ninth child, a son with girlfriend Jasmin Brown. Newton, who also has two children with Brown and four with ex-girlfriend Kia Proctor, emphasizes love and accountability in his large family. Despite post-NFL challenges, his children remain his greatest source of strength and purpose.

title: Report: Westbrook gets big China offer amid LeBron scapegoat buzz
description: Russell Westbrook, a free agent after his time with the Denver Nuggets, is reportedly considering a massive offer from an unnamed Chinese team. This deal is rumored to be quadruple what the Sacramento Kings could have offered. The move comes after Westbrook faced scapegoating during his tenure with the Los Angeles Lakers.

title: Microsoft engineer quits after 13 years; sends resignation email to employees
description: A senior Microsoft engineer has resigned protesting the company's cloud contracts with the Israeli military. Scott Sutfin-Glowski cited enabling potential atrocities as his reason for leaving. This follows months of internal dissent and employee firings over Gaza-related demonstrations. Microsoft previously stopped some services to an Israeli intelligence unit after a report. However, many contracts remain active, and employee protests continue. Activists demand a complete cut of ties with Israel.
